<Link id="l00208" /><CodeLine lineNumber="208"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Try to promote memory values to scalars by sinking stores out of</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00209" /><CodeLine lineNumber="209"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// the loop and moving loads to before the loop.  We do this by looping over</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00210" /><CodeLine lineNumber="210"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// the stores in the loop, looking for stores to Must pointers which are</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00211" /><CodeLine lineNumber="211"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// loop invariant. It takes a set of must-alias values, Loop exit blocks</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00212" /><CodeLine lineNumber="212"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// vector, loop exit blocks insertion point vector, PredIteratorCache,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00213" /><CodeLine lineNumber="213"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// LoopInfo, DominatorTree, Loop, AliasSet information for all instructions</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00214" /><CodeLine lineNumber="214"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// of the loop and loop safety information as arguments.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00215" /><CodeLine lineNumber="215"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Diagnostics is emitted via \\p ORE. It returns changed status.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00216" /><CodeLine lineNumber="216"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// \\p AllowSpeculation is whether values should be hoisted even if they are not</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00241" /><CodeLine lineNumber="241"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Create a new loop identifier for a loop created from a loop transformation.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00242" /><CodeLine lineNumber="242"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00243" /><CodeLine lineNumber="243"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// @param OrigLoopID The loop ID of the loop before the transformation.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00244" /><CodeLine lineNumber="244"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// @param FollowupAttrs List of attribute names that contain attributes to be</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00245" /><CodeLine lineNumber="245"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///                      added to the new loop ID.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00246" /><CodeLine lineNumber="246"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// @param InheritOptionsAttrsPrefix Selects which attributes should be inherited</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00247" /><CodeLine lineNumber="247"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///                                  from the original loop. The following values</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00248" /><CodeLine lineNumber="248"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///                                  are considered:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00249" /><CodeLine lineNumber="249"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///        nullptr   : Inherit all attributes from @p OrigLoopID.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00250" /><CodeLine lineNumber="250"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///        &quot;&quot;        : Do not inherit any attribute from @p OrigLoopID; only use</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00251" /><CodeLine lineNumber="251"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///                    those specified by a followup attribute.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00252" /><CodeLine lineNumber="252"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///        &quot;&lt;prefix&gt;&quot;: Inherit all attributes except those which start with</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00253" /><CodeLine lineNumber="253"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///                    &lt;prefix&gt;; commonly used to remove metadata for the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00254" /><CodeLine lineNumber="254"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///                    applied transformation.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00255" /><CodeLine lineNumber="255"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// @param AlwaysNew If true, do not try to reuse OrigLoopID and never return</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00256" /><CodeLine lineNumber="256"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///                  std::nullopt.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00257" /><CodeLine lineNumber="257"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00258" /><CodeLine lineNumber="258"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// @return The loop ID for the after-transformation loop. The following values</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00259" /><CodeLine lineNumber="259"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///         can be returned:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00260" /><CodeLine lineNumber="260"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///         std::nullopt : No followup attribute was found; it is up to the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00261" /><CodeLine lineNumber="261"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///                        transformation to choose attributes that make sense.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00262" /><CodeLine lineNumber="262"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///         @p OrigLoopID: The original identifier can be reused.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00263" /><CodeLine lineNumber="263"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///         nullptr      : The new loop has no attributes.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00264" /><CodeLine lineNumber="264"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///         MDNode&#42;      : A new unique loop identifier.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00265" /><CodeLine lineNumber="265"><span class="doxyHighlight">std::optional&lt;MDNode &#42;&gt;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00266" /><CodeLine lineNumber="266"><span class="doxyHighlight"><a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a368216c9c116e3f30d8dd352ce1370fc">makeFollowupLoopID</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mdnode">MDNode</a> &#42;OrigLoopID, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/arrayref">ArrayRef&lt;StringRef&gt;</a> FollowupAttrs,</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00349" /><CodeLine lineNumber="349"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// instructions is the responsibility of the caller since it is challenging to</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00350" /><CodeLine lineNumber="350"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// do efficiently from within this routine.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00351" /><CodeLine lineNumber="351"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// \\p TargetExecutesOncePerLoop is true only when it is guaranteed that the</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00497" /><CodeLine lineNumber="497"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Set weights for \\p UnrolledLoop and \\p RemainderLoop based on weights for</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00498" /><CodeLine lineNumber="498"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// \\p OrigLoop and the following distribution of \\p OrigLoop iteration among \\p</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00499" /><CodeLine lineNumber="499"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// UnrolledLoop and \\p RemainderLoop. \\p UnrolledLoop receives weights that</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00501" /><CodeLine lineNumber="501"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// the remaining TC%UF iterations.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00502" /><CodeLine lineNumber="502"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00503" /><CodeLine lineNumber="503"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Note that \\p OrigLoop may be equal to either \\p UnrolledLoop or \\p</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00504" /><CodeLine lineNumber="504"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// RemainderLoop in which case weights for \\p OrigLoop are updated accordingly.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00505" /><CodeLine lineNumber="505"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Note also behavior is undefined if \\p UnrolledLoop and \\p RemainderLoop are</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00508" /><CodeLine lineNumber="508"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00509" /><CodeLine lineNumber="509"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// This utility may be useful for such optimizations as unroller and</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00514" /><CodeLine lineNumber="514"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Utility that implements appending of loops onto a worklist given a range.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00515" /><CodeLine lineNumber="515"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// We want to process loops in postorder, but the worklist is a LIFO data</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00516" /><CodeLine lineNumber="516"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// structure, so we append to it in &#42;reverse&#42; postorder.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00517" /><CodeLine lineNumber="517"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// For trees, a preorder traversal is a viable reverse postorder, so we</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00518" /><CodeLine lineNumber="518"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// actually append using a preorder walk algorithm.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00519" /><CodeLine lineNumber="519"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">template</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> &lt;</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">typename</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> RangeT&gt;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00520" /><CodeLine lineNumber="520"><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">void</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#ab7a106c600cf32852298d9041e8c8044">appendLoopsToWorklist</a>(RangeT &amp;&amp;, SmallPriorityWorklist&lt;Loop &#42;, 4&gt; &amp;);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00521" /><CodeLine lineNumber="521"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Utility that implements appending of loops onto a worklist given a range.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00522" /><CodeLine lineNumber="522"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// It has the same behavior as appendLoopsToWorklist, but assumes the range of</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00523" /><CodeLine lineNumber="523"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// loops has already been reversed, so it processes loops in the given order.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00524" /><CodeLine lineNumber="524"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">template</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> &lt;</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">typename</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> RangeT&gt;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00528" /><CodeLine lineNumber="528"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Utility that implements appending of loops onto a worklist given LoopInfo.</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00572" /><CodeLine lineNumber="572"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00573" /><CodeLine lineNumber="573"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Check if the loop header has a conditional branch that is not</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00574" /><CodeLine lineNumber="574"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// loop-invariant, because it involves load instructions. If all paths from</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00575" /><CodeLine lineNumber="575"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// either the true or false successor to the header or loop exists do not</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00576" /><CodeLine lineNumber="576"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// modify the memory feeding the condition, perform &#39;partial unswitching&#39;. That</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00577" /><CodeLine lineNumber="577"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// is, duplicate the instructions feeding the condition in the pre-header. Then</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00578" /><CodeLine lineNumber="578"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// unswitch on the duplicated condition. The condition is now known in the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00579" /><CodeLine lineNumber="579"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// unswitched version for the &#39;invariant&#39; path through the original loop.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00580" /><CodeLine lineNumber="580"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00581" /><CodeLine lineNumber="581"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// If the branch condition of the header is partially invariant, return a pair</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00582" /><CodeLine lineNumber="582"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// containing the instructions to duplicate and a boolean Constant to update</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00583" /><CodeLine lineNumber="583"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// the condition in the loops created for the true or false successors.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00584" /><CodeLine lineNumber="584"><span class="doxyHighlight">std::optional&lt;IVConditionInfo&gt; <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#ae78f734e49b5ad94836bf32dda101ec6">hasPartialIVCondition</a>(</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/loop">Loop</a> &amp;L,</span></CodeLine>
